meanings.definition: An upward displacement of rock strata in a geological fault.
meanings.sent1: The upthrow of the rocks created a steep cliff.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the upthrow of the fault line.
meanings.sent3: The upthrow of the rocks made it challenging for climbers.
meanings.sent4: The upthrow of the earth's layers revealed ancient fossils.
meanings.sent5: The upthrow of the strata was a clear sign of tectonic activity.

meanings.definition: To throw upward or raise up.
meanings.sent1: She tried to upthrow the ball as high as she could.
meanings.sent2: He upthrew the rope to help his friend climb up.
meanings.sent3: The magician upthrew the cards into the air with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind upthrew the leaves from the ground.
meanings.sent5: The weightlifter upthrew the barbell effortlessly.

meanings.definition: The act of throwing something upward.
meanings.sent1: His upthrow of the ball reached the top of the tree.
meanings.sent2: The child's upthrow of the toy surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The upthrow of the paper airplane landed it on the roof.
meanings.sent4: The upthrow of the frisbee went higher than expected.
meanings.sent5: Her upthrow of the stone skipped across the water.
